intro: Monadenia conferta, commonly known as the African sandveld daisy, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies, sunflowers, and thistles. The plant is characterized by its small, yellow-orange flowers that bloom in dense clusters, often resembling a daisy. Monadenia conferta typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. It is often used in local horticulture for its ornamental value and drought tolerance.
